title: Principles of Methods
description: In-depth analysis of methods principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Introduction to Workshop
description: Interdisciplinary approach to workshop combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Applied Workshop
description: Interdisciplinary approach to workshop combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Intermediate Research
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in research. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Methods
description: Advanced exploration of methods covering current research and industry practices.

title: Research
description: Comprehensive study of research with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Analysis
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in analysis. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Graduate Theory
description: Comprehensive study of theory with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: SMGT 352 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Seminar
description: Comprehensive study of seminar with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: SMGT 391 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Seminar
description: Interdisciplinary approach to seminar combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: SMGT 320 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Workshop
description: Rigorous treatment of workshop theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: SMGT 328 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Methods
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of methods. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: SMGT 379 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Workshop
description: Comprehensive study of workshop with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: SMGT 319 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Theory
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of theory. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: SMGT 362 and senior standing or graduate status
